texts.definition: Cases where players can by luck find correct solutions for problems.
markups: <style="Definition">Cases where players can by luck find correct solutions for problems.</style>

Players need to perform actions in all but the rarest of games, and in many cases may have many different actions to choose from. <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style> can occur in the case of puzzles or other situation where picking one action over others is vital and, most often, have instant good consequences.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Roulette">Roulette</link></style> is more or less built upon the idea of <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style>. Similarly, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Cluedo">Cluedo</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Mastermind">Mastermind</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ricochet%20Robots">Ricochet Robots</link></style> are examples <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Games</link></style> where <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style> can give players victories. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Bejeweled">Bejeweled</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Minesweeper">Minesweeper</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Sokoban">Sokoban</link></style> are all computer-based <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Puzzle%20Games">Puzzle Games</link></style> that allow for <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style>. Similarly, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Adventure%20Games">Adventure Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/The%20Dig">The Dig</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/King's%20Quest%20series">King's Quest series</link></style>, and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Myst%20series">Myst series</link></style> allow for <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style>.

While <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style> can be created by how <style="Link"><link="puzzle-solving">Puzzle Solving</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="solution-uncertainty">Solution Uncertainty</link></style> is designed, the use of <style="Link"><link="trial-error-solutions">Trial and Error Solutions</link></style> guarantees its presence. <style="Link"><link="quizzes">Quizzes</link></style> is a specific type of challenges that often can allow <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style>.

The most obvious effect of having <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style> in games is that it provide a possibility for players to have <style="Link"><link="luck">Luck</link></style>. It may also give players a feeling of <style="Link"><link="player-agency">Player Agency</link></style> but this is a volatile design since players not feeling that the guess was an extension of their intentionality will have an opposite reaction.

Players trying to make use of <style="CurrentLink">Lucky Guess Solutions</style> causes <style="Link"><link="performance-uncertainty">Performance Uncertainty</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="player-unpredictability">Player Unpredictability</link></style> in those game instances.
